The appointment of Army Gen: Gustave Perna as the chief operating officer of Operation Warp Speed, a joint project of the Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) and the Department of Defense, which aims to accelerate the development, manufacturing, and distribution of a COVID-19 vaccine.

The CDC's Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices and other committees formed by the National Academies of Sciences, Engineering, and Medicine are also involved in planning for the equitable allocation of vaccines against COVID-19.
The utilization of traditional vaccine d: as confirmed by a senior HHS official. The logistics of distribution and manufacturing, including assembling vaccination kits, will be handled by the Department of Defense.
The ongoing work and challenges related: as described by senior administration officials. These challenges include planning for different scenarios, setting priorities for limited doses, and creating an IT system to track individuals receiving the vaccine.
